name: Auction Hunters
overview:
Auction Hunters is an American reality television series that premiered on November 9, 2010, on Spike and is produced by Gurney Productions Inc. It also airs internationally.

In June 2011, Spike announced that it had ordered a third season of 26 episodes. In August 2012, Spike announced that it had ordered a fourth season of 26 episodes. The fourth season premiered on January 30, 2013.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview: Every day in America, there are over ten thousand abandoned storage units that are put up for public auction. Each unit has the potential to be a goldmine or a bust for those who make their living hunting unclaimed property. This eight half-hour episode series follows two of the best prospectors in the business, Clinton "Ton" Jones and Allen Haff, in their quest to win auctions, acquire treasure and sell it for profit.

episodes.name: The Big Score
episodes.overview: 1800s British Pepperbox handgun; pre WWI Lionel train set.

episodes.name: The Wild West
episodes.overview: A '70s German H&K P7 pistol; a rare 1910 copper cash register.

episodes.name: Ton's Got a Gun
episodes.overview: A depression era ``Art Case'' slot machine; a custom mini-bike; a Wild West 1800s Colt Peacemaker.

episodes.name: Strat'ed for Cash
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen stake out a high-end auction. They uncover a Maui Blue '70s Fender Stratocaster and a rare 1936 jet-inspired Schwinn, but will this rusty ride rake in the riches?

episodes.name: The Real Thing
episodes.overview: Clinton and Allen find a vintage Coke vending machine and a classic truck in their auction wins.

episodes.name: Weapons of Past Destruction
episodes.overview: Muskets dating to the Civil War period and a polygraph machine are among the items Clinton and Allen find in storage units they win this week.

episodes.name: Gangster Whiskey
episodes.overview: A rare baseball card, a classic jukebox and an early model CD player are among items found by Alan and Clinton in their auction wins.

episodes.name: Home on the Gun Range
episodes.overview: An old penny arcade game and a shotgun that is more than one hundred years old are among the items Allen and Clinton find in units they win at auction.

episodes.name: Miami Heat
episodes.overview: A 1970s NASA countdown clock, an all-terrain hovercraft and a 1960s Delta relay rocket are featured.

episodes.name: Quadzilla Attacks
episodes.overview: An 1880s Palm-Squeezer pistol, a Western Electric telephone from the 1800s and a Quadzilla ATV are examined.

episodes.name: Sink or Swim
episodes.overview: An 1897 Regina music box, an Addictor 190 mini boat and a Thomas Edison gramophone from 1905 are examined.

episodes.name: Disco and Dance
episodes.overview: A 1978 pinball machine, a vintage Breathalyzer and an 1898 gambling device are featured.

episodes.name: Labor of Love
episodes.overview: A Ms. Pac-Man arcade machine, a Harley-Davidson engine and an Air Jordan vintage shoe collection are examined.

episodes.name: The Chicago Grand Slam
episodes.overview: A 1984 Yamaha SS440 Snowmobile; a baseball signed by Hank Aaron; a toy robot from the 1950s.

episodes.name: The Chi-Town Showdown
episodes.overview: See a metal casket from the Victorian period; glass fire extinguisher grenades from the 1870's; a Chicago fire station alarm box from 1896.

episodes.name: Fire in the Hole!
episodes.overview: A detonator box for dynamite, a chest that has secret compartments and jewelry used in smelting are found in units Clinton and Allen win at auction.

episodes.name: Animal Instincts
episodes.overview: An 1897 Winchester pump-action shotgun; big-game taxidermy.

episodes.name: Everything's Bigger in Texas
episodes.overview: An 1886 Winchester riffle designed to kill buffalo; 1950s electric slot cars.

episodes.name: Smoking Ton
episodes.overview: A 1890 humidor, a WWII-era Stuart M3 tank barrel and an industrial meat slicer are found in Worchester, Mass. Deep in Boston’s south side, Allen and Ton outbid some raucous competition. The guys score a WW2 Stuart M3 tank barrel and heavy duty tank treads. They also discover an industrial meat slicer in...

episodes.name: Top Gun Ton
episodes.overview: An Ontario, Cal., auction is visited, where the hosts compete with high rollers; a Gundlach Korona large format field camera from the 1920s and a scale RC Viper Fan Jet aircraft are featured.

episodes.name: Beantown Bidders
episodes.overview: A 1940s tandem bicycle, a black powder whaling harpoon from the 1800s and a vintage American flag collection are found in Boston.

episodes.name: Diesel Digs
episodes.overview:
A 1981 Bobcat 743 Front Loader and a World

War I artifact are featured.

episodes.name: Dallas Mavericks
episodes.overview: The guys go to Dallas, where they find a handcrafted cowboy saddle and a Tomahawk cruise missile jet engine. Allen and Ton travel to Dallas and face off against Texas’ most elite buyers. The guys uncover a military-grade Tomahawk cruise missile jet engine and a century-old handcrafted wild west cowboy...

episodes.name: Knuckle Dust
episodes.overview: An autographed "Raging Bull" poster; a revolver-knife-brass knuckle combo from the 1870s; a George Rodrigue "Blue Dog" screen print.

episodes.name: Half Pipe Dreams
episodes.overview: A bulletproof vest and a SWAT team helmet are discovered. Also: A Z-Flex Jimmy Plumer Poolrider skateboard from the 1970s is featured.

episodes.name: Viva la Vegas
episodes.overview: A naval cane sword from the 1800s; a 1910 poster of magician Chung Ling Soo; a Zig Zag magic sword box from 1974.

episodes.name: Rodeo Ton
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen head to the Beverly Hills of Orange County, Anaheim, and score a 1970s El Toro mechanical bull used to train bull riders, a silver WWII era banjo, and a collection of 1800s...

episodes.name: Sin City Shootout
episodes.overview: The guys head to Las Vegas, NV and discover a bumper car designed to look like a 1953 Chevy, M16 rifle magazines, a photo booth and a set of potato guns.

episodes.name: Battle Bought
episodes.overview: Remote-controlled combat robots from the 1990s; an 1800s French "Harmonica Pistol" are featured.

episodes.name: Hot Wheels
episodes.overview: A 1970s dune racer; off-road racing gear; a 1965 replica Mustang pool table.

episodes.name: Great American Cashtime
episodes.overview: Rare Master Pitch baseball machine from the 1950's; Jaws of Life tool from the 1980's.

episodes.name: Auction Hunters, Ink.
episodes.overview: Allen and Ton are back in LA for a high-end storage auction and score an autographed 1960s Bob Shaw Swing Gate tattoo machine. Later, the guys uncover a Terry Ives competition chainsaw and a six foot chainsaw-carved cedar bear.

episodes.name: Reel Money
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen travel to a container auction in San Diego and encounter some reckless spenders. They discover a "laser tag" system used for military training and refurbish a 1970's-era Fighting Chair used for big-game fishing.

episodes.name: Early Bird Special
episodes.overview: Shooting Star carnival game; MMA octagon fighting cage.

episodes.name: Cold Hard Cash
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen go North to Alaska and get a cold reception from the local auctioneer. They find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers, including the most powerful production handgun in the world!

episodes.name: Ton's Driller Instinct
episodes.overview: Ton & Allen encounter aggressive outdoorsmen in the Alaskan wilderness. The guys discover an 8-wheeled ATV that travels on both land & water and an air percussion hammer that can drill through solid rock!

episodes.name: Hidden Hot Wheels
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen challenge an auction buyer on his home turf; The guys find a 1969 Chevelle Malibu.

episodes.name: Auction Hunter Shuffle
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen teach an new auction hunter a lesson and find a 1940s shuffleboard and a hot rod made from part of a WWII fighter plane.

episodes.name: Big Easy Money
episodes.overview: Allen & Ton find more than easy money in New Orleans when they encounter bayou bidders with money.

episodes.name: High Flying Ton
episodes.overview: Allen and Ton are off to Ventura, CA, looking to crack open some container units that have been sitting there for ages. Thinking about pricey fishing gear and even Hollywood memorabilia, the boys are pumped to go in there and do what they do best.

episodes.name: Drumming Up Cash
episodes.overview: Ton & Allen face some silent but deadly competition at an auction in nearby Glendale. They discover a Zildjian brand percussion cymbal from the 1940’s and a pyrotechnics control board designed for large-scale fireworks displays!

episodes.name: Bowling Pin Payday
episodes.overview: Allen & Ton visit Ton’s old stompin’ ground and go head-to-head with a trash-talking auction buyer. They uncover a 19th century rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet and a mechanical bowling pinsetter from the early 1960’s!

episodes.name: Fake Punt Payoff
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen contend with a large crowd of inexperienced auction-buyers at a huge storage container auction in Pasadena. They find a small fleet of Segway personal transporters and an enormous custom-made shotgun.

episodes.name: The Jersey Score
episodes.overview: Ton & Allen attend a silent auction in NJ, but that doesn't stop the local buyers from letting them know they're not welcome! They uncover a skeet throwing machine from the 1960's & a vintage vehicle with some real horsepower!

episodes.name: Allen's Got Balls
episodes.overview: The guys clash with a familiar foe. Also: A vehicle that picks up golf balls and an accurate rifle are featured.

episodes.name: Mr. Haff Goes to Washington
episodes.overview: The guys visit Washington, D.C., where they find a Civil War-era revolver and gold coins from South Africa.

episodes.name: Voodoo Moola
episodes.overview: The guys run into trouble at a storage auction in Baton Rouge. Featured: an antique barber chair and a pair of racing lawn mowers.

episodes.name: Dead Aim
episodes.overview: The guys meet a rival with shady bidding tactics. Featured: a monowheel and a rifle built to scare off grave robbers.

episodes.name: Sidecar Surprise
episodes.overview: The guys visit Virginia for an auction. Featured: a military motorcycle from Russia and a 19th-century cannon.

episodes.name: Little-Ton Jones
episodes.overview: An amateur rocket and machinery for mining gold are featured.

episodes.name: Choo-Choo, Cha-Ching!
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen get a surprise second chance after nearly getting shut out in the small town of Palmer. They uncover a motorized railroad maintenance car from the 1960’s and a pre-WWI Japanese semi-automatic pistol

episodes.name: Ton's Hot Commodity
episodes.overview: Allen is late to the auction, leaving Ton to battle a feisty female auction buyer on his own! The guys find a fully functional flamethrower and a rare hand-carved bow and arrow set from South America!

episodes.name: Ice, Ice, Baby
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen have to get aggressive when they encounter a towering opponent with a mountain of cash.

episodes.name: Gangs of New York
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen duke it out with a local thrift store gang at a Brooklyn storage auction.

episodes.name: Allen's Ruff Day
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen head to an auction in Ton’s hometown and end up battling with a big-mouthed buyer. They discover a pair of tranquilizer dart guns and also end up fighting with a K9!

episodes.name: Hula Moola
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen jet to the Hawaiian islands where they’re joined by a feisty new female assistant! The team uncovers a pair of James Bond-style gadgets designed for high-speed underwater travel and a vintage sled used to race down the mountain

episodes.name: Friends in Hawaii Places
episodes.overview: Allen & Ton enlist an assistant, Carolyn, and Allen’s Hawaiian buddy, Junior, to help them battle local buyers.

episodes.name: Money Makin' Monster Machines
episodes.overview: The Auction Hunters team goes on the attack & ends up on a collision course with a hardened veteran auction buyer.

episodes.name: Once a Pawn a Time
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen discover that owning a pawn shop is way more trouble than they expected. With bills stacking up, even an antique ammo collection and some classic football helmets may not be enough to put the guys in the black.

episodes.name: Win Lose or Joust
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen race back from an auction to purchase a rare comic valued at over $100,000. The guys uncover a Samurai sword used for ritual suicide and Allen lives out his childhood fantasy of becoming knight.

episodes.name: It's Raining Ton
episodes.overview: The guys take Big Sis to her first auction - and when things get ugly, she becomes their secret weapon. Ton tests out a "blob" and Allen gets shot with a riot gun.

episodes.name: Rock-et to Me!
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen end up in a turf war at a Hollywood auction and at odds with each other over whether to gamble on what could be an antique slot machine. Allen attempts to fly a jetpack.

episodes.name: Off the Deep End
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen quarrel over bidding strategy at a rare auction on Catalina Island and must race against the clock to unload a one man submersible that could be worth big money… if they can make it work.

episodes.name: Trading Places
episodes.overview: When an injury sidelines Allen, he stays at the shop while Ton takes Big Sis to the auction and goes rogue, ignoring Allen's advice and making risky purchases that could lose the partners a boatload of cash.

episodes.name: Flying Ton, Creeping Allen
episodes.overview: When a group of thugs try to bully Ton and Allen out of a Chinatown auction, the guys fight back, leading to a violent showdown and the discovery of both a rare Bornean blowgun and special effects wire harnesses.

episodes.name: Whip It Good
episodes.overview: With a motocross bike and a rare stock whip up for grabs, Ton and Allen face one of their toughest competitors yet: their former employee Carolyn, who knows all their tricks, has money to burn and is out for revenge.

episodes.name: Machine Gun Ton
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen battle a pair of vicious female auction hunters who have an axe to grind and bid based on spite rather than strategy. And a gatling gun & suit of armor are worth much less than the guys expected.

episodes.name: Always Money in Philadelphia
episodes.overview: In Philadelphia, the guys face a shady bidder with inside information and former NFL star Vince Papale in a battle for a vintage football passing machine and a colonial musket that could be worth huge money...if it’s real.

episodes.name: Carolyn Goes Topless
episodes.overview: A friendly competition with former employee Carolyn turns into a vicious battle for a 1968 Corvette Stingray, giving Carolyn the last laugh. Allen tests his Ninja skills with an antique sickle weapon.

episodes.name: Don't Taze Me Bro
episodes.overview: Two fierce opponents best Ton and Allen at the auction, leaving the duo in the lurch with a “trash unit” and little chance of breaking even for the day. And Ton gets tazed.

episodes.name: The Fall Guys
episodes.overview: The pressures of running a shop are taking a toll on Ton and Allen and not even the discovery of a stunt-man's fall bag can ease the tension. When things get heated, Ton abandons the partnership and leaves town.

episodes.name: Separation Anxiety
episodes.overview: Allen struggles to keep the pawn shop afloat while training Elle; After a fierce bidding war with Caroline, pieces from a century old motorcycle may not be enough.

episodes.name: Allen vs. Ton
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen find themselves bidding against each other at an auction; the fate of the pawnshop and their friendship is in question.

episodes.name: You Got Served
episodes.overview: The guys leave an auction empty handed and try to find new merchandise at a yard sale; questionable antique tennis rackets and an ancient special effects box may not earn them anything.

episodes.name: Without a Chute
episodes.overview: The shop's landlord wants to talk to the guys; Allen puts an experimental powered parachute to the test.

episodes.name: Ton Voyage
episodes.overview: A ruthless store owner tries to stop Ton and Allen from scoring new items in Santa Barbara so they fight back; the guys uncover a rare antique air gun and a vintage wooden boat built for speed.

episodes.name: You Foos You Lose
episodes.overview: When their truck breaks down, Ton and Allen lay it all on the line to raise money to fix her. They score a Foosball table, Tommy Gun drums and to Ton's delight, a treasure trove of Twinkies, but will it be enough?

episodes.name: Allen's Big Crush
episodes.overview: Battling it out with a former-employee; a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are the last chance.

episodes.name: Nothing But Net
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen are challenged by two old rivals; the guys dig up an off-road motorcycle and a pair of net guns; the staff clashes with mystery shoppers.

episodes.name: Hall of Fame Game
episodes.overview: Ton and Big Sis revamp the shop to bring in customers; a Ouija board and a set of antique basketballs; Allen goes toe-to-toe with an NBA Hall of Famer.

episodes.name: Cashville, Tennessee
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen rumble with a band of high-bidding bikers; the guys discover a 37 millimeter anti-tank gun and a cowboy's rodeo saddle.

episodes.name: Big Sis Ducks Out
episodes.overview: Big Sis drops brings bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit in Long Beach; a Native American tomahawk, a dunk tank and a rare gun that can fire three shots at once.

episodes.name: Gone in 20 Seconds
episodes.overview: Uncovering a Geiger counter and NASCAR impact wrenches; shocking news from the accountant.

episodes.name: To Pawn or Not To Pawn
episodes.overview: A face-off with Carolyn in Covina; a special effects unit; deciding the fate of the shop.

episodes.name: Space Cowboys
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen uncover an antique World War II firearm and a Russian space suit, which could be their biggest find yet.

episodes.name: Ramped Up
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen go up against their former assistant, Carolyn, while Ton battles a bad back. The two find an automatic BB gun, and Allen faces a tough decision when negotiations to sell a stunt ramp go south.

episodes.name: Hook, Line and Printer
episodes.overview: A last-minute auction in Norwalk proves challenging when Ton and Allen go toe-to-toe with a real life cowboy couple. When the dust settles, the guys uncover a 3D printer and a grappling hook gun they can’t wait to shoot.

episodes.name: Rock and Roll
episodes.overview: An auction in Whittier gets ugly when a buyer named Big Dave tries to take it all. After some tough losses, the guys win a state of the art food truck and an off-road rock crawler with dangerous consequences.

episodes.name: Betsy's Last Stand
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen head to an auction in hopes of mending their bread truck, Betsy; an industrial grinder and a classic Chevy.

episodes.name: Risk & Reward
episodes.overview: Ton & Allen arrive late to an auction. They uncover vintage bear traps and a bounty of street art. If the pieces belong to the artist, RISK, it could be their biggest score ever. If not, they'll be stuck with forged knockoffs.

episodes.name: Blazing Saddles
episodes.overview: Ton and Allen head to a Hollywood auction and face a new competitor with a seemingly endless cash flow. After they uncover a triple barrel shotgun...

episodes.name: Party Gras
episodes.overview: On a trip to New Orleans, Ton and Allen look to mix business with pleasure. They wage war with some locals at a tough auction, win a Mardi Gras...

episodes.name: Louisiana Purchase
episodes.overview: In Louisiana, Ton and Allen encounter some salty locals at a shipping crate auction, and navigate choppy waters at a boat auction.

5.name: Season 5
5.overview: Every day in America, there are over ten thousand abandoned storage units that are put up for public auction. Each unit has the potential to be a goldmine or a bust for those who make their living hunting unclaimed property. This eight half-hour episode series follows two of the best prospectors in the business, Clinton "Ton" Jones and Allen Haff, in their quest to win auctions, acquire treasure and sell it for profit.
